image.altText: A man with cap and white beard at a racing stables leans on a fence.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's leading greyhound trainer wins his appeal against a lifetime ban, with an appeals board ruling it cannot be ruled out that a person "motivated" by "strongly held" beliefs planted a marsupial tail in order to discredit him.

title.children: Top greyhound trainer's lifetime ban overturned, with appeal board unable to rule out sabotage by animal activists

image.altText: Traffic backed up on a highway.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government promised in 2018 to build a fifth lane on Hobart's Southern Outlet. Newly-released documents show there's been a cost blow-out "well in excess" of the $51 million budgeted for the project.

title.children: Rockfall risk and design complications blow out cost of expanded Hobart highway

image.altText: A generic graphic image of a woman covering her face as money rains down.

props.synopsis: Parents are being squeezed by the cost of sending kids to school, whether their children are attending public or private, according to two new studies.

title.children: 'Free' public school education projected to cost parents more than $92,000 from prep to year 12

image.altText: Man in suit walking with black umbrella in Melbourne trees in the background

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia are under a severe storm risk on Wednesday with likely severe storms in southern NSW and north-east Victoria.

title.children: Mid-summer soaking continues as 'life threatening flash flooding' possible from Wednesday storms

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton's heads in profile are aligned in the centre of the frame, Albanese scratching his neck.

props.synopsis: Will the by-election produce an average anti-government swing and see Labor retain Dunkley, or will we see larger swing that delivers victory to the Liberal Party? Either way, it's set to frame politics for the first half of 2024, writes Antony Green.

title.children: America's election year has kicked off, but at home a different contest will frame 2024 for Albanese and Dutton

image.altText: Aerial shot of new cars lined up at port

props.synopsis: A string of recent developments, from battery manufacturing to new engine efficiency rules, will affect the price you pay for a new car.

title.children: Battery prices are tipped to fall 40 per cent. Here's what that means for cheaper EVs

image.altText: Donald Trump holding his hands aloft and smiling

props.synopsis: The Iowa caucuses were never a question of if Donald Trump could win, but of by how much. The first race of the 2024 election still held a few surprises. These are the key takeaways.

title.children: A Trump tsunami and a surprise in second place: What to know about the first key vote of 2024

image.altText: Trump, wearing a white campaign cap, poses with a stern face in front of a screen that reads Trump Country

props.synopsis: Would ordinary Americans really vote for the return of a politician currently facing 91 criminal charges? Thanks to Iowa, we have the answer from Republican voters and it is a resounding yes, writes Leigh Sales.

title.children: Why do Americans want to give Donald Trump another chance as president? His reality holds magical appeal

image.altText: Stephen Edwards with parents David and Nelda

props.synopsis: Brothers Stephen and Robert Edwards have given evidence in the inquest into their parents' 2016 deaths. The brothers had previously been charged in relation to their mother's death, but the charges were later dropped.

title.children: Elderly woman was not in imminent danger of death when given palliative care drugs, inquest hears

image.altText: Purple ute travelling on major Tasmanian highway as seen by a dash cam in pursuing car.

props.synopsis: Two women are charged after a Hobart Hurricanes ute was captured on video travelling down a highway with a person in back holding down a box — but the cricket club won't say if the pair are players.

title.children: Women charged after illegal act in cricket club ute exposed on social media

image.altText: a graphic of a computer aith an ai-generated woman on the screen

props.synopsis: The federal government will follow the European Union and several other nations to develop a risk-based response to the rapid rise in use of artificial intelligence, setting down stricter rules for risky AI, while staying out of the way of low-risk tools.

title.children: Government lays out plan for 'safeguards' on risky artificial technology, while allowing low-risk AI to flourish

image.altText: Container ship at the Melbourne wharves

props.synopsis: The current row between a Dubai-owned stevedore, DP World, and the Maritime Union of Australia could reignite inflation and cause the Reserve Bank to continue lifting interest rates, experts say.

title.children: How a pay dispute at Australia's ports could see prices rise, reigniting inflation

image.altText: Rhesus monkey in cage

props.synopsis: Scientists report cloning a monkey using a technique that most famously gave us Dolly the sheep in 1996. So what's new about this study, and what does it mean for humans?

title.children: What's so special about ReTro the cloned rhesus monkey? Five quick questions answered

image.altText: Male tennis player, eyes closed, looking upward, arms raised in triumph.

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis has gone some way towards vanquishing last year's heartbreaking Australian Open loss to Andy Murray by claiming a typical five-set victory in his Melbourne Park opener.

title.children: Thanasi Kokkinakis comes from behind to win epic fifth-set tie-break — as it happened

image.altText: A close up of a baby maugean skate, grey with spots.

props.synopsis: With intensive salmon farming degrading the habitat for the endangered Maugean skate, hope was placed in a captive breeding program. But weeks after it starts, two of the four rays are dead.

title.children: Scientists hoped to save endangered ray from a degraded harbour. But half have died in captivity within weeks

image.altText: The Danish flag flying between the Australian and Tasmanian flags at parliament house in Hobart

props.synopsis: To celebrate Tasmania's own locally born royal, the Danish flag was yesterday flown at parliament house along with the Australian and state flags.The Aboriginal flag was taken down to fit it.

title.children: Row over Danish flag replacing Aboriginal flag above Tasmanian parliament building

image.altText: Max Purcell pumps his fist during a match at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: It's not just Alex de Minaur flying the Australian flag in the men's draw at Melbourne Park, with Davis Cup teammate Max Purcell coming off a sensational 2023 season that saw him crack the top 50.

title.children: While de Minaur is attracting the hype, another Aussie is determined to make an impact at the AO

image.altText: A composite picture of Elton John, Sarah Snook and Niecy Nash.

props.synopsis: Elton John reaches EGOT status and 'play-off mama' strikes an awkward note. Here were the key moments from the 75th annual Emmy Awards.

title.children: From awkward 'play-offs' to emphatic wins, here were the key moments from the 75th annual Emmy Awards

image.altText: a young girl with a shore behind her

props.synopsis: A family holiday turned into a "crisis" when a jellyfish sting caused a severe allergic reaction for a three-year-old girl on K'Gari (Fraser Island), and emergency services faced complications that led to treatment delays.

title.children: Mum whose 3yo was 'foaming at the mouth' calls for better marine stinger warnings, wash stations, on K'Gari

image.altText: crowds at the tennis

props.synopsis: Players at Australia's grand slam are split on a new seating policy that lets fans into the stands twice as often during a match.

title.children: 'Wokest tournament ever': Australian Open seating policy ruffles players' feathers

image.altText: A tennis player clenches her fist in triumph as she holds her racquet after winning a match.

props.synopsis: Ash Barty left many an opponent frustrated during her illustrious career, including the woman who replaced her at the top of the world rankings.

title.children: How Ash Barty 'annoyed' Iga Świątek into becoming world number one

image.altText: A man with a black and grey bear wearing a red shirt holds a round egg in his fingers.

props.synopsis: His hens have laid more than a million eggs over the past five years, but Fabian Fabbro on the New South Wales North Coast has never seen anything quite like this.

title.children: After collecting more than one million eggs from his hens, NSW farmer Fabian Fabbro makes a unique discovery

image.altText: People carry a coffin at a funeral. They are wearing traditional clothing.

props.synopsis: The remains of two Tongan males stored in the Australian Museum's collection in Sydney have been repatriated to their present-day descendants and laid to rest in a royal funeral service attended by hundreds.

title.children: Two Tongan skulls held in a Sydney museum have been repatriated to their traditional owners

image.altText: Smoke rises over a city at night in the aftermath of a missile attack.

props.synopsis: Iran's Revolutionary Guards says it hit a headquarters of Mossad, the Israeli intelligence agency, in the Kurdish region of Iraq.

title.children: Iran strikes targets in northern Iraq and Syria as regional tensions escalate

image.altText: A child plays near the beach in Nauru during the Pacific Islands Forum.

props.synopsis: The Australian government says it "respects" the decision taken by Nauru to sever diplomatic relations with Taiwan and recognise China instead.

title.children: Nauru gave Australia advanced warning of decision to sever ties with Taiwan and recognise China

image.altText: An image of a person holding up a go card to pink and black ticket reader

props.synopsis: Translink confirms smart ticketing will now be trialled on buses this year, despite the state government previously suggesting it would be up and running by 2023.

title.children: Queensland government's $371m public transport smart ticketing rollout hit with delays

image.altText: Matthew Simpson, 16, and Addison Bhimjiani, 17 were passengers in a fatal car crash

props.synopsis: Matthew Simpson and Addison Bhimjiani were passengers in a car being driven by another 17-year-old, when they ploughed into a power pole on Windsor Road on Monday night.

title.children: Two teenagers in fatal car crash in Sydney's north-west remembered as 'beautiful boys'

image.altText: Two young men in suits in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Ash Gordon beat the odds in his quest to dedicate his life to caring for others. On the weekend, the 33-year-old was fatally stabbed during a home invasion. His loved ones want the world to know how proud they were of the remarkable man.

title.children: ‘What's the world come to?': Family of slain Victorian GP calls for crackdown on crime

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old man will spend the next three days in jail after refusing to give evidence during a committal hearing into an alleged murder in southern Queensland.

title.children: Witness in alleged hit-and-run murder jailed for refusing to testify

image.altText: Lightning strikes off the coast of a beach

props.synopsis: A summer storm has pummelled WA's Wheatbelt and eastern parts of Perth on a 41 degree day, with thousands of residents expected to be without power until Wednesday.

title.children: Homes damaged by falling trees, flash flooding as severe thunderstorm leaves thousands without power

image.altText: Ash Gardner and Faith Thomas look at each other and smile, as Gardner has her arm around Thomas' shoulder

props.synopsis: Ashleigh Gardner has always been a special player. But from ruthless hard-hitter to a calculated bowler, the all-rounder has undergone an incredible transformation to find herself nominated for ICC Women's Cricketer of the Year.

title.children: The shift in mindset that saw Ash Gardner become the best bowler in the world

image.altText: An Extinction Rebellion protester hangs from a bridge.

props.synopsis: Meme Caroline Thorne, whose peak-hour protest outside the Adelaide Convention Centre during an oil and gas conference triggered the SA government to introduce new anti-obstruction laws, is ordered to pay $750 in compensation to the emergency services who retrieved her.

title.children: Extinction Rebellion bridge abseiler who halted Adelaide traffic sentenced over protest

image.altText: A woman crying and being comforted

props.synopsis: Dallas Hayden — the wife of former governor-general and one-time Labor Party leader Bill Hayden — has died, after her husband's passing last October.

title.children: Dallas Hayden dies less than three months after her husband, former governor-general Bill Hayden

image.altText: Police helicopter in hangar

props.synopsis: In response to a recent crime wave in Townsville, the Queensland government has ordered a dedicated police chopper and digitally encrypted radios meant to stop criminals intercepting communications.

title.children: New police chopper and $13 million encrypted radio system to fight crime in north Queensland

image.altText: A shirtless man holds a cigarette

props.synopsis: An Australian man accused of multiple counts of child sexual abuse is the subject of an arrest warrant in Timor-Leste, after failing to show up to court last month.

title.children: Australian man facing child sex abuse charges in Timor-Leste
